attributes.action: A law to stop firms discriminating against people who do not get vaccinated.
attributes.additional_details: It is critical that individuals are allowed to make informed choices on whether they wish to be vaccinated for COVID and other viruses. The government has a duty to protect these people, in the same way that people are protected legally against discrimination on grounds of colour, race, disability or religion. There is a real risk that organisations such as airlines, airports, cinemas, sports & music stadiums may decide not to allow non-vaccinated individuals to use their services. LEGISLATE NOW
attributes.background: I want the government to bring in legislation that stops businesses & organisations from discriminating against those who decide not to be vaccinated. It is critical that people are allowed to make decisions about whether to be vaccinated or not. Organisations should not be allowed to discriminate.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/323442
